channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024061795
item.description:
Report X-2024061795

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 275000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Remote control locomotive operator free rolled 5 load tank cars from the switching lead into class track 20 which struck tank car CTCX 730096. The B-end stub sill buckled causing the tank shell to crush in on itself. The B-end head shoe pulled the outer most point of repad off the tank shell. The repad continued to be pulled away from the tank shell towards the center of the car until the tank shell tore vertically at the body bolster.

item.title: Report X-2024061550
item.description:
Report X-2024061550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Package was on a 53 trailer with other packages surrounded by another hazmat. The package had effected multiple people that was around the strong smell. The facility did the proper procedure and filed all who were affected. The specialist was called by the facility and the Hazmat package is no longer in building for additional information.

item.title: Report X-2024061195
item.description:
Report X-2024061195

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: NS Intermodal ramp personnel reported an unidentified flammable liquid leaking from FDUX 536129. There was no impact to waterways and there was no injuries noted. It was determined that 1 of 4 totes was ruptured due to load shift and had leaked to empty. All of the contents were placed on poly next to the vessel. The tote in question was isolated and wrapped in poly.

item.title: Report X-2024061261
item.description:
Report X-2024061261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36600
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The GATX 8245 was reported leaking. Upon inspection of the car by the local Fire Department Hazmat team, the sample line valve was found in the open position with the plug not installed. The fire department closed the valve stopping the release. The plug was then installed into the valve body. Full waste manifest number...018353864FLE
